author: pmcgoohan
content: Different topic, although it all comes back around.

author: pmcgoohan
content: Dominant extractors will be relays because anything else has too much latency (and trust).

author: pmcgoohan
content:
They will never move onto PBS because it has even worse latency (5 secs+?)
So PBS is a waste of time.

author: sky.cactus
content: You don't need ultra low latency to be profitable as a builder.  While there is a tiny bit of advantage to low latency, it isn't particularly significant.

author: pmcgoohan
content: It's hugely significant, especially for cross chain/layer/CEX which will be the bulk of MEV

author: pmcgoohan
content: Extractors already use bloxroute or even their own private networks to reduce read latency

author: pmcgoohan
content: They will also use bloxroute style write networks

author: sky.cactus
content: Proof of Work blocks show up at random time intervals which has a notable impact on timing things.  To be clear, I do agree that there is a speed advantage under PoS still, I just argue that it is lower than under Proof of Work due to consistent timing.

author: pmcgoohan
content: It's got nothing to do with eth block timings. Its about builders leaving it to the last microsecond to send blocks to producers to arb against other chains/layers/CEXs for which they'll be paying $$$ for low latency feeds. No chance they'll suddenly choose to introduce a 5 sec latency to their write path by using PBS

author: pmcgoohan
content: I mean a low latency private write network for sending builder blocks to validators, similar to Bloxroute provide for.reading txs and blocks

author: pmcgoohan
content: To be clear, Bloxroute have not expressed any intention of doing this, before I get myself into trouble with them. I'll call it a private write network from now on

author: pmcgoohan
content: Point is it gives extractors an advantage over PBS, so they'll use it instead

author: barnabemonnot
content: I'm not sure about the argument you're making. Is the argument that builders will collude with proposers in the two-slot in-protocol PBS design, and so can publish the proposer commitment and the builder block as late as possible?

author: pmcgoohan
content: No, it's that the most successful builders won't use PBS at all because it's too high latency. Extractors and validators are highly incentivized to collude and to do it as efficiently as possible so that both make the most money. Private networks will always beat decentralized ones on speed, so thats what they'll use. Most mev will involve arbing against exchanges outside Ethereum on other layers/chains/CEXs where latency is very important.

author: pmcgoohan
content: The good news is (for similar reasons), we don't need PBS because there is no chance extractors will buy validators to extract and create a centralization threat. It's always more efficient for them to collude instead.

author: pmcgoohan
content: In summary: PBS won't achieve its aims, but its ok, it isn't needed anyway.
